result.execSummary:
On one or more charges, the deferred prosecution or sentencing agreement(s) on this case were fulfilled, and the charge(s) were dismissed.

The defendant Mark L. Skordahl was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of THC, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).
  • Possess Drug Paraphernalia, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.573(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Counts 2 and 3 to run Concurrent.
Count 1 in Deferred Judgment of Conviction.
Defendant to report to Probation today October 16, 2015.

  
In the event that the defendant is revoked or discharged from either probation or extended supervision with outstanding financial obligations, the supervising agent shall notify the court 10 days prior to the revocation or discharge.  A civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victim(s) and/or governmental entities for any balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect all debt.
Concurrent with: Count 3

miscConds.notes: $243.00 to be collected by DOC as a condition of probation in Count 2 Case #14CF216.

-Zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia.
-Random UA testing permitted at the discretion of Law Enforcement.
AODA and follow any recommended treatment.

CO: Lundell, RPR: Val Deiss, Clerk: Webb, ADA: Michael Edward Nieskes, DF ATTY: John A. Kucinski, DF: Mark L. Skordahl appeared.  Court called at1:34 p.m. DE files a Plea Questionnaire and Waiver of Rights Form with the Court.  State files an amended Information with the Court.  State files a DJOC for Ct. 1.  Crt reviews plea questionnaire and informs DE of rights. Crt finds DE freely, voluntarily and knowingly waives rights and makes plea.  Court reads charge and maximum penalty.  DE pleads No Contest to Ct 1.  DE pleads No Contest to the amended Ct. 2.  DE pleads No Contest to Ct. 3.  Crt uses the testimony at the preliminary hearings for a factual basis.  Crt accepts plea, finds factual basis and stays the adjudication on Ct. 1 and finds the DE adjudicated guilty of Ct 2 & Ct. 3.   Sentencing arguments. Crt orders:

Ct. 1 Court reviews the DJOC with the DE and signs the Order

Ct. 2 to run concurrent with Ct. 3
- S/W 1 year probation with conditions
- AODA and follow through with any recommended
- Zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times while this case is ongoing. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia. 
- Random UA testing permitted at discretion of law enforcement.
- Court costs of $486.00 to be paid through the DOC
- DE to sign up with probation today 10/16/15 
- 20 days to appeal
Filed by ADA Minser. Requesting a Plea Date. km
Plea/sentencing hearing at 10-16-2015 01:00 pm

Jury trial on September 22, 2015 at 09:00 am.
Motion hearing on August 26, 2015 at 09:00 am.

Attorney Kucinski makes argument.  Court will review the file.  Set out for Jury Trial.  Bail is continued.  Court adjourned at 10:46 a.m. lw  Jury trial scheduled for September 22, 2015 at 09:00 am.  Motion hearing scheduled for August 26, 2015 at 09:00 am.
